title: Salman Rushdie - Midnight's Child
description:
Midnight\\\&#039;s Children is a 1981 novel by Salman Rushdie. It centres on the author\\\&#039;s native India and was acclaimed as a major milestone in postcolonial literature.

It won both the 1981 Booker Prize and the James Tait Black Memorial Prize for the same year. It was awarded the \\\"Booker of Bookers\\\" Prize, the best all-time prize winners, both in 1993 and 2008 to celebrate the Booker Prize 25th and 40th anniversary.[1][2] Midnight\\\&#039;s Children is also the only Indian novel on Time\\\&#039;s list of the 100 best English-language novels since its founding in 1923.[3]
